display.label: AWS Glue
display.description: Manage AWS Glue crawlers, jobs and triggers

connections.label: AWS Glue Access Key and Secret
connections.comments: Authenticates requests to AWS Glue using an API Key and API Secret.

inputs.comments: An AWS IAM Access Key ID
inputs.label: Access Key ID

inputs.comments: An AWS IAM Secret Access Key
inputs.label: Secret Access Key

documentation.description:
An AWS IAM [access key pair](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_access-keys.html) is required to interact with AWS Glue.
Make sure that the key pair you generate in AWS has proper permissions to the AWS Glue resources you want to access.
Read more about Glue IAM actions in the [AWS docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/glue/latest/dg/create-an-iam-role.html).

display.label: Get Job Run
display.description: Retrieves the metadata for a given job run.

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the run Id.
inputs.label: Run Id

display.label: List Triggers
display.description: List the names of all triggers in the account.

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide an integer value for the maximum amount of items that will be returned. Provide a value from 1 to 50.
inputs.label: Max Items

inputs.comments: Specify the pagination token that's returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results
inputs.label: Marker

display.label: Start Crawler
display.description: Starts an existing crawler in AWS Glue.

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

display.label: Start Job Run
display.description: Starts a job run using a AWS Glue job definition.

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

inputs.comments: The number of AWS Glue data processing units (DPUs) that can be allocated when this job runs. If this is omitted, Glue will use the default number of DPUs configured for your job.
inputs.label: Allocated Capacity

inputs.comments: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this job. This can be left blank if you do not have a security configuration.
inputs.label: Security Configuration

inputs.comments: Optional key value parameters to pass into a job.
inputs.label: args

display.label: Start Trigger
display.description: Starts an existing trigger in AWS Glue.

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

display.label: Stop Crawler
display.description: If the specified crawler is running, stops the crawl

inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

display.label: Stop Job Run
display.description: Stops one or more job runs for a specified job definition

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

inputs.comments: Provide a list of job run Ids
inputs.label: Job Run Ids

inputs.comments: AWS provides services in multiple regions, like us-west-2 or eu-east-1. AWS region indicates the region in which your DynamoDb instance is hosted
inputs.label: AWS Region

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the name (NOT the ARN).
inputs.label: Name

documentation.description:
[AWS Glue](https://aws.amazon.com/glue) is a serverless data integration service from Amazon Web Services.
The AWS Glue component allows you to interact with jobs, triggers, and crawlers in your AWS Glue account.
